modelCorrections.rawOutput:
Here's the corrected HTML based on the WCAG 2.1 violation description and the example provided:

*Extracted text from website*: "Capital"
- Incorrect HTML: <html>
- Corrected HTML: <html lang="en">

Explanation:
The <html> element should have a lang attribute to specify the language of the document. This helps assistive technologies, such as screen readers, to pronounce the content correctly and enables translation tools to identify the language accurately. In this case, assuming the content is in English, the corrected HTML includes the lang attribute with the value "en".
